channel.title: New Spiked Blade Model! (Made From Scratch!)
channel.description:
[size=24pt]Okay, new release, this is "From Scratch!" I was working on it all night (Including thinking of the idea, taking pictures, putting on download site, making it, and much more...) But yea hope you all like it! (: (Have No Ints, So sorry![/size]
Front Below:
[IMG]http://i1068.photobucket.com/albums/u442/ictbguud/FrontOfSpikedBlade.jpg[/img]
Right Side Below:
[IMG]http://i1068.photobucket.com/albums/u442/ictbguud/RightSideOfSpikedBlade.jpg[/img]
Left Side Below:
[IMG]http://i1068.photobucket.com/albums/u442/ictbguud/LeftSideOfSpikedBlade.jpg[/img]
Wire Frame On The Right Side Below:
[IMG]http://i1068.photobucket.com/albums/u442/ictbguud/SpikedBladeWireFrame.jpg[/img]
It In A Characters Hand Below:
[IMG]http://i1068.photobucket.com/albums/u442/ictbguud/SpikedBladeInHand.jpg[/img]
[size=24pt]The Name Of It Is Called "Spiked Blade"[/size]
[size=24pt]Download Link Below:[/size]
[size=36pt] http://uppit.com/pkfrh3z2jwi7/Spiked_Blade.rar [/size]

item.title: New Spiked Blade Model! (Made From Scratch!)
item.dc:creator: @ictbguud ictbguud
item.description:
@ictbguud wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:9, topic:443224”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=545912.msg4001909#msg4001909 date=1338141866]
Try photoshopping a design and adding it to the handle… I don’t know how hard that is, but you could try.
[/quote]
If you mean UV mapping it properly as well, then you are asking a lot of the OP.

Well done, just looked at your robot, and now this. Glad to see you are showing some quick improvements. When you take wire frame pictures, try and turn view faces on so that its easier to see. As is though, can’t say there are many problems, your on the right track. And remember: always make your next model your best model. If not in concept, at least in topology.[/quote]

Thanks so much for the support! (:.

Thanks so much for the rep++ Tyb97! (:

Read full topic

@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:9, topic:443224”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=545912.msg4001909#msg4001909 date=1338141866]
Try photoshopping a design and adding it to the handle… I don’t know how hard that is, but you could try.
[/quote]
If you mean UV mapping it properly as well, then you are asking a lot of the OP.[/quote]
Oh well, it could be a good learning experience for him.

item.source: New Spiked Blade Model! (Made From Scratch!)

item.title: New Spiked Blade Model! (Made From Scratch!)
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

tyb97:

Try photoshopping a design and adding it to the handle… I don’t know how hard that is, but you could try.

If you mean UV mapping it properly as well, then you are asking a lot of the OP.

Well done, just looked at your robot, and now this. Glad to see you are showing some quick improvements. When you take wire frame pictures, try and turn view faces on so that its easier to see. As is though, can’t say there are many problems, your on the right track. And remember: always make your next model your best model. If not in concept, at least in topology.

Read full topic

item.title: New Spiked Blade Model! (Made From Scratch!)
item.dc:creator: @ictbguud ictbguud
item.description:
@ictbguud wrote:

tyb97:

Try photoshopping a design and adding it to the handle… I don’t know how hard that is, but you could try.

I might try that soon (:!

But atm I’m making another model from scratch, it’s a Ninja Star Shield! ^. ^…

item.description:
@ictbguud wrote:

Thank you guys so much for replying and I started out with lines, then done Triangles, and puffed it up, copied, pasted it, made it a mirror and put spikes on it :).

item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Did you use primitives? Regardless, nice improvement. My only suggestion is to not take your Wireframe pictures at an angle. I’ll see if I can critique it more when im on my pc.

Read full topic

item.title: New Spiked Blade Model! (Made From Scratch!)
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

You’re starting to get the hang of modeling now, I can tell. One thing I would recommend is not to use a solid, pure black, as it pretty much takes away all the shading in Metasequoia, which means you can’t see any depth.

Read full topic
